website_summaries.verdict: A comprehensive heart rate monitor for those who also want to monitor fitness activity, calories burned, and other health data.
cons: Chest strap may cause skin irritation
Owners are restricted to Garmin app

website_summaries.verdict: The always-on display and long battery life make the Garmin Vivofit 2 an appealing alternative to the Jawbone Up2 and Fitbit Charge.
pros: The Vivofit 2 has an always-on display, one year of battery life, and can be worn in the shower and the pool
The new model adds a stopwatch mode, a backlight, audible alerts, inactivity alerts and a greatly improved wrist band
cons: There's no vibration, syncing isn't automatic and the Garmin mobile app doesn't provide detailed enough information or any smart coaching insights

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Not worth it .......it works perfectly .......does what it say .....but very cheap quality and damged product being send is not acceptable ......the screen looks as if it's torn or damged I don't know ......but it's damged that's for sure from day one.............,.. My second opinion has not changed ......it's sync complete .....but no data......either the app is no good or the device is no good .......in the pic the it's become like small size penny ...... Never buy ......
customer_reviews.author: Crazy shopper

customer_reviews.title: Almost useless!
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this device. The first day I had it, I set it up and synced it to my computer and it counted my steps, no problem. That was the ONE and ONLY day I got it to sync!!! Pressing the button does nothing except switch from steps to the current time. The backlight doesn't work either. I don't use it for sleep. The fact that I can't look up and see how many steps I took yesterday and the day before, etc., renders this device almost useless.
customer_reviews.author: Cats Books and Wine (Things I Like)

customer_reviews.title: I love this watch
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch!!!!!! I have the vivofit 1 and it is awesome. My son lost his vivofit 1 so I bought this as a replacement. The vivofit Garmins are comfortable. I wear mine all the time - especially to bed. I find the the step count is fairly accurate (as accurate as can be). I love to see how much I've slept. It may not be perfectly accurate in recording sleep time, but it is nice to get a general idea. The only downfall is that when I go over a particular bridge, it counts the cracks in the bridge as steps. The band on the vivofit 2 is much nicer than that of the vivofit 1.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Kearns

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Garmin
customer_reviews.text: I bought Garmin's watch because it doesn't need to be charged regularly like other fitness watches. However, I regret my purchase. Most of Garmin's services have been down for over two weeks, and they don't seem to care. Their customer service is non-existent, and they won't even say they are working on the issue. I'm going to have to spring for another fitness watch to replace my Garmin since it seems they are incapable of fixing their issues. Does anyone know of a good one that does not need charging? If so, please leave me a comment below.
customer_reviews.author: KindleBabe

customer_reviews.title: The best tracker they ever made.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned Vivofit 3 and 4 and they both suck compared to this model IMO. I owned Vivosmart HR+ and it sucks because you have to recharge it with a crappy weird recharger every 3 days. I found myself ignoring it because I couldn't wear it all the time. I also hate how the Vivofit 3 and 4 come with small crappy bands. For me it's Vivofit 2 with its awesome large display and its XL bands, or nothing. Lets hope they get it right with the Vivofit 5 because the Vivofit 3 and 4 are steps in the wrong direction.
customer_reviews.author: Hu, Yi-Su

customer_reviews.title: Not bulky love back-lit feature. Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Love this fitbit! Had original fitbit and the band popped off never to be found. Primary reason for purchase was locking band which works great. Had heart rate monitor from original fitbit. Was able to pair using the app on Android. Had to go into settings and allow heart rate to be visible on the band interface. Then had to power off heart rate monitor and once power back up it paired. Make sure band screen is on heart rate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Watch won't sync.
customer_reviews.text: Watch won't sync with computer, no matter what we try. Research shows this is a common problem. Garmin's instructions for syncing contra-dict each other. Written in poor English. After over an hour trying, researching, retrying, I gave up. Will call support tomorrow. Concept is good. Watch is attractive enough, although watch band is really cheap. But until they resolve the wifi and syncing glitches, stick with Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: John Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: I personally have one and LOVE it. I've been wearing mine for over two ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one as a gift. I personally have one and LOVE it. I've been wearing mine for over two years, and the battery is still going. You never have to charge these. I did replace my band about 3 months ago, but I can't complain after getting almost two years out of every day wear. I will not purchase any other brand activity tracker after this fantastic experience with Garmin. When my time comes to replace this, I will look to Garmin once again. The ease of app use, the fact that it syncs with just about every other app on the market--these are all a plus. Extremely happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Starlitmoonbeam

customer_reviews.title: was planning to get the vivofit 4 but too many bad reviews.
customer_reviews.text: used the original vivofit for 4 years... was planning to get the vivofit 4 but too many bad reviews.. looked at the vivofit 3 and they took away features. Went down to the vivofit 2 and very happy with it. Love the ability to not have to charge it. Also love the added back light and timers from the original vivofit. Hoping when they release the vivofit 5, they will get back to what they do best and stop trying to be a fitbit imitation.
customer_reviews.author: Rob DeVenuto

customer_reviews.title: Tracking my sleep
customer_reviews.text: I bought This tracker mainly to monitor my sleeping. This is my second one. I don't take it off at all so it gets a lot of wear. I wear it in the shower and the pool. I don't know how accurate the step counter is. I don't try for the 10000 recommended steps but I can see those days where I don't get a lot of movement and I try to step it up. I bought This one because I don't have to charge it, it works on battery power which was important to me, plus it is waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: K. S. Chestnut

customer_reviews.title: Good tracker at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Good tracker. I love that I can wear it to swim in and shower in. I wish the app was more accurate in how it tracks various activities. It of course tracks well with running and walking. The customer service is great. Garmin replaced my last one for free just days out of the 1 year warranty. I had called them after I replaced the battery and my last tracker had malfunctioned. Thank you, Garmin! And thank you, Amazon for doing business with Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. McFarland

customer_reviews.title: Way better than FitBit!
customer_reviews.text: I had three Fitbit’s before I purchased the Vivofit 2. Why three? Two of them are replacements for breaking within six months. If you like a lot of data storage and trending, then you will like the Garmin app. I would give the app only four stars. However, I would give the Vivofit 2 five stars. I wear it every day, during swimming, biking and heavy sweating. I have replaced the batteries every 10 months and the waterproof seal is still great since 2016! The tracker is incredibly affordable, reliable, and accurate. Photo is with an after market watch on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly G. Ley

customer_reviews.title: Lacks Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: Received as a gift. Batteries were dead out of the box. Purchased and installed new batteries, and found that the unit was defective. Because it was purchased in well advance of the holidays, it could not be returned to the seller for refund. Contacted the manufacturer who confirmed the unit was defective and agreed to send me a factory second as a replacement. Not impressed with the tracker or the company at this point. It was a bad purchase and I would not recommend it to others who considering purchasing this product.
customer_reviews.author: Steven D Heires

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a big fan of this product. It has good battery life. It's water proof. It works as it's supposed to. My issues with are more with the fact that it isn't accurate and it doesn't know the difference between activities. It sets everything as if I'm running, it doesn't track any other type of workout. The results are not accurate, as far as calories or sleep are concerned. It's good if you want a cheap tracker for your runs but otherwise, I'd upgrade to a more sophisticated model with a heart rate tracker and things of that nature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wear it everyday; all day!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd Vivofit I have purchased as I broke the bracelet on my first one so the ease of replacing the bracelet is an appreciated feature on this one. I also have the Garmin HR one with the golf course GPS capability that I use for golf but find it too large for everyday wear and this VIVO2 I can wear to bed to monitor my sleep. The year long battery is also great...as I find it a bit of a nuisance having to charge my golf one. So I love this Vivo2; wear it everyday and find it helps me keep moving.
customer_reviews.author: samWhalen

customer_reviews.title: Great Device
customer_reviews.text: I will start by saying I love this device. I've had it now for a couple months and it is all I needed in a tracking device, compared to the one I had before. I didn't give a five star rating because just recently I've been having some issues with syncing the device with the app which sometimes can be a little annoying, I'm not sure if this is cause by the new Garmin software update. I had to completely reset the device, which caused some data loss, I hope Garmin continues to work the issues out. Otherwise I absolutely love it and I would recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: Suzette Ward

customer_reviews.title: Works OK But The Screen Could Be A Little Bit Brighter
customer_reviews.text: It works OK. I just would prefer that the display was a whole lot brighter. If there was a setting that could either dim it or brighten it to the point that it could actually be seen without having to stare at it for a while to figure out what is being displayed that would make me love it. I couldn't find it though in the Ap settings. At least not to the point that I could fine tune it to my preferences. I'm not an old dude by any means, but I could sure use the screen to be a little bit more user-friendly. Other than that it does all that it says it does.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof and you never have to take it off!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter lost numerous FitBits (not sure how). We found this one and it's perfect. It's waterproof, the battery lasts over a year, and the steps count down instead of up. She can shower in it, so she never has to take it off (thus not lose it!). Thank you Garmin!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Schulz

customer_reviews.title: ... has encouraged me to move more often and always fun to see what I have accomplished by the end ...
customer_reviews.text: It has encouraged me to move more often and always fun to see what I have accomplished by the end of the day. Also, I work at night and have been concerned about the quality of my sleep during the day. It is an eye-opener that I'm either not getting enough sleep or sleeping as soundly as I should. The manual is a bit disappointing in that it doesn't fully explain some things. I've had to Google more information and still have not found out how to connect to Connections. Username, email address, what?
customer_reviews.author: L. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate. Probably slightly more useful than a dumb watch unless you pay a lot of attention to it.
customer_reviews.text: It's nice when it's working, but their software and algorithm is kinda a joke. Frequently fails to sync for days and lose data. When I am playing games, it thinks i am sleeping. Walk tracking is fine, except if I am waving my hands, or washing my hair, etc, they are all counted as "walking". So one has to monitor the numbers and manually adjust a bit. However, at least I don't have to charge every month or week. That's a huge plus for me. It's at least a competent watch, just a bit too expensive for a simple watch.
customer_reviews.author: WuJJ

customer_reviews.title: This is why I'll never have a Fitbit again!
customer_reviews.text: I got rid my Fitbit Flex and got a Garmin, and will never look back. It syncs easier, and you don't have to charge it constantly. I've had it on since March 2017, and it's still going. I love not having to constantly plug it in. I've had no issues. In two years, three Fitbits died on me, one in just a week. This is a much better device for a much better price.
customer_reviews.author: robin677

customer_reviews.title: It's my best friend. Whether It's the middle of the night ...
customer_reviews.text: It's my best friend. Whether It's the middle of the night and I want to see what time it is without burning my corneas alive by turning on my phone or I'm running around the neighborhood trying to meet a new mileage goal- it's always there for me. It's adequate and very simple to use. It's a must-have for people that just care about the work and the fitness over anything else (meaning you don't need all that fancy gadget stuff). You don't have to use the application for it if you don't want to (although I do believe you need it to configure the watch at the beginning). It's just perfect....
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: No heart rate monitor which contradicts what they say in the "From the Manufacturer" description.
customer_reviews.text: Description of the item said we can view the heart rate, but the item has no way of monitoring heart rate. Here is what they say in the description: "Get up and get moving with the vivofit 2 activity tracker. With 1 year battery life and backlit, night-readable display you can see how many steps you’ve taken, distance travelled, calories burned, heart rate, time and more. It even reminds you to stay active throughout your day with its move bar with audible alert that lets you know when you’ve been idle for an hour or longer." Seems to work otherwise, but very disappointing that they advertised being able to have heart rate displayed but don't provide that capability.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry G

customer_reviews.title: Constant difficulties syncing to Android phone
customer_reviews.text: I have a Moto Z Force phone. Once paired with my app, the Vivofit had sporadic connection issues. I've tried restarting all devices, re-pairing, toggling Bluetooth and GPS, andst about everything, but I've found no pattern to the problem. The watch interface itself is easy to use. The screen is easy to read. Despite my playing competitive ultimate frisbee with it, the watch holds up great. I still use it when I want to know stats on my exercise, but I just don't bother trying to sync it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Read the update!!! Everything changed after I changed the batteries!!
customer_reviews.text: Update: So strange!! After two weeks the display came back!!! I am giving it 5 stars again!!! I love this tracker!!!! Everything was going great until I had to change the battery —after a 19 months! After I changed the batteries I couldn’t see the display. Then they came back—somewhat! Now the numbers are cut in half—I can only see the bottom half of the numbers. Super disappointed since I loved my Garmin VivioFit 2!!!! Should they last more than 19 months???
customer_reviews.author: TamTams Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great tracker
customer_reviews.text: Like the Garmin vivofit 2 so well that when my husband needed a new Garmin, I bought him the same model. One of the best things about this tracker is the new style of band. The band lays flat on your wrist and has an extra 'latch' type part so that it should be extra secure. My husband had a problem with the original Garmin band coming undone. This new style should work well for him.
customer_reviews.author: Awesome shopper

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your Buck. Better than the Vivofit 3 or 4
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Vivofit 2. This is the one. If you want a year plus battery life, look no further. I used my hard for over 2 years. Water, beach, ocean, swim shower, it just keep going. Up till when the screen started to die but not after 3 plus years of use. It pairs with a heart monitor unlike the Vivofit 3 or 4. Monitors sleep steps and activity.
customer_reviews.author: Steve of PA

customer_reviews.title: love the garmin
customer_reviews.text: water proof, long lasting battery, dont have to take off and charge it. 2 of the main reasons i have it. Sleep tracking does not always seem to be accurate, or the calorie counter. This is second one, exact same that i have had, and both have worked awesome, other then those two issues. Both had them.
customer_reviews.author: Tlc

customer_reviews.title: Just the wee nudge I need to keep moving
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't nag me and the battery lasts about a year, so no charging needed. I like the little red line that reminds me I've been sitting too long. Easy to read, very reliable. I really like how the tracker adjusts to previous day's activity. For example, if you've been sick and out of commission, it lowers your goal so you don't get hit with a 14,000 step goal the first day back on track.
customer_reviews.author: ACS

customer_reviews.title: Two years and runs like a champ.....
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Garmin Vivofit 2 for two years and couldn’t be happier! This is my first activity band, I was a little skeptical but after much research, I bought it. Two years later, wearing it EVERYDAY, it is still working like a champ, so happy! I like that’s it’s easy to put on by myself (after showering, swimming) with very little effort. Several people that I know have a different product, then they see my Garmin and they like it better because of the clear digital readout that is always on (I don’t have to press a button for the readout to appear). I also loved the price and how easily it paired with my iPhone!
customer_reviews.author: Chinco

customer_reviews.title: 1 year and still going strong! Water proof and don't have to charge it!!!
customer_reviews.text: **UPDATE** Now on 1+ year of owning this with no issues. Has survived multiple trips to the NJ shore, my salt pool and daily showers.... Bought this for the wife instead of getting another Fitbit...This fits the bill in every way and survives the shower on a daily basis while negating the need to charge it every day or two. The wife is extremely pleased!!!! Had to get the red one.....
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Great Great
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Tried the FitBit but didn't want to charge it every night...Also, wan't accurate. Tried the Garmin Vivofit with heart monitor and felt too heavy on my wrist and kept twisting around. This Vivofit 2 is best! Accurate and comfortable. Try out different colored bands, but make sure you buy Garmin brand, not a knockoff without the turnkey lock on the back of the button that closes the band. Has never come off yet! Also, be sure to wear fairly tightly on wrist for accuracy; not loose like a bracelet watch. Only wish the time were better lit for darker places.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny Oklahoma

customer_reviews.title: It works for me.
customer_reviews.text: This tracker was purchased for sleep tracking after trying the more popular brands. My experience with the others was that you had to recharge them often and the reports were inaccurate. Not the Garmin vivofit 2. It works well and I never have to recharge it. Great phone and PC app too.
customer_reviews.author: EG75

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed now in the product as I am afraid the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had my vivofit 2 since March 2016 and have never replaced the battery. Today when I was changing out the band the plastic two pronged side broke off on one side. I change my bands almost weekly and certainly know how to safely do it. Really disappointed now in the product as I am afraid the second side will also break and I will have a functioning tracker that won't fit or stay in any band. I still like the product for everything that it does but not happy about the cheapness of the casing.
customer_reviews.author: KarenJohns

customer_reviews.title: Works great, water proof, great battery life
customer_reviews.text: I inherited it from my XCX running daughter who upgraded to a better running tracker. Works just great, water proof and the battery has far exceeded the year and we are easily at two years now. Comfortable and doesn't get in the way. Easy to use and see. I only wish I could see the time in the dark but who doesn't carry a cell phone for those times? Bought one for my father and mother in law as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kcc247

customer_reviews.title: Nice tracking watch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch for my 10 year son. The watch came with two different size bands and he is able to wear the smaller band comfortably. The watch reliably paired with my computer and gives pretty good information with their computer app (Windows 10). The watch is water proof and fairly comfortable on the wrist. The only thing is that the band is a bit difficult for a younger person to latch and lock. I usually have to help him. Otherwise, pretty good watch.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Loved it until it died
customer_reviews.text: Came quickly. Loved it until it died. It claims that it lasts for a year and over but it didn't last me 8 months. I was pretty bummed. Even bought my husband a newer one (the 3rd generation) and his died within 2 months of having it. We won't be buying Garmin Vivofits any time soon. We will be taking our business to ones that can charge.
customer_reviews.author: S & B Cason

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: After my latest (expensive!) Fitbit died, lasting less than a year, I decided to try a different activity tracker. I was worried about having to learn a new system and figuring out how to get it up and running on both my iPhone and laptop. I spent a lot of time reading reviews and looking into how different trackers would fit my needs before deciding on the Garmin Vivofit 2. I am so glad I gave up on Fitbit! The Vivofit 2 is less than half the price, does everything my Charge HR did (except measuring heart rate) and it was easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Becky W

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: I owned the original Garmin Vivofit and liked it, so when it finally gave up the ghost I decided to replace it with this one. What a freaking disaster... First off the band is virtually impossible to keep on my wrist during any vigorous workout. Secondly, the sync function worked fine until they pushed a software update, now it does absolutely nothing. And, it's not horribly accurate even when it does work. Garmin makes great GPS units but I'll never purchase one of their fitness trackers again.
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Kane

customer_reviews.title: Great product so far.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for myself and my husband. I have previously owned a Fitbit and already prefer the Garmin Vivofit 2. The good: I like that you can see the progress on the wristband without having to sync to your phone. I like the watch feature. I have a small wrist and fits well, it doesn't feel large and gaudy. You do not have to charge it because of the year battery life. The bad: The only con is that it doesn't auto sync like the Fitbit, but that's not a deal breaker for me because you can see all of your progress on your wrist.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read, convenient, and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Simple reliable device. I bought this for an elderly family member that wanted an easy-to-read, easy-to-use tracker. It isn't the newest, most feature packed unit on the market, but the one year battery life, water resistance, and ease of use make this a great step counter and fitness tracker. Keep in mind, that with this, and most other trackers, it is not a stand alone device. You must pair it with a smart phone, tablet, or computer to set it up and use it. It comes with a Bluetooth Ant+ USB dongle to pair with your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Kneel

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 10. She wears hers every day and even in the shower. A fitness band was recommended by her pediatrician. She has been wearing this since Christmas. The first one stopped working. Amazon promptly sent out a replacement. She has been wearing the second one for over a month. She loves it. She loves being able to tell the time and her steps. The backlight is nice, and appropriately bright. It is not so bright that everyone in a movie theater would be upset. Haha. The beep that alerts you to move is very brief and not a real distraction. She is allowed to wear this at her school. We have had no complaints about it disturbing anyone.
customer_reviews.author: simplegirl

customer_reviews.title: I'm still working out the settings and connectivity issues.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself. It is comfortable and waterproof so I leave it on all the time. I think I need to readjust my step length because it is not registering the correct mileage for a route that I have verified with my car odometer. And now that I'm walking inside on my treadmill, I have to remember to not hold on to the rail with that hand or the tracker won't register any steps. I'm finding the application confusing. It doesn't always show steps for a day when I obviously had some. I push SYNC but sometimes nothing happens. I'll figure it out eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Problem with syncing the Vivofit 2
customer_reviews.text: I have had the Vivofit 2 for four months. I like that it uses a watch battery so you don't have to keep recharging and it seems to keep an accurate count of the steps. The one issue I have with it is that it does a bad job of syncing so you can keep track of your steps over time. I use my PC to sync the tracker with the accompanying ANT stick. Unfortunately the sync feature on the Garmin Express software works less than one in five times. Update: A month after writing the above review I updated the software and now the ANT stick seems to sync fine so I changed from 3 to 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: metasequoia

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Yes it tracks steps. In theory, it tracks sleep. But the damn thing will only very rarely sync. I've no idea what the problem is. It shows the ant stick is connected. I hit sync. Nothing happens. Sometimes it shows sleep for a day or two in a row but almost never steps--which is why I bought this. I've tried deleting and then re-installing the app (I'm using a computer) TWICE but it made no difference.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Kotler

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed with the tracker and returned it for a refund
customer_reviews.text: I had received a Garmin Vivofit 2 as a gift approximately 2 years ago. Unfortunately I lost it recently and wanted to replace it with same type (i.e. Vivofit 2). I placed the order and received the Garmin. I registered on Garmin Connect and put it on my wrist. I immediately noticed that my steps were not being counted accurately. I would walk while looking at my garmin and no steps were being tracked and then steps would start to count. I was very disappointed with the tracker and returned it for a refund. I'm still looking to replace my tracker and will have to research which one to purchase,
customer_reviews.author: ilovecoffee

customer_reviews.title: I think it's a pretty good alternative to some of the other similar items ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the wife. She loves it, and even though she's a bit in the stone age as far as technology goes, (she got her first smartphone 3 weeks ago), she was able to hook up to her phone, and download her activities. She's been following the activity logs, entering her nutritional info, and monitoring her sleep patters ever since she got it, and really likes it. I think it's a pretty good alternative to some of the other similar items out there. I like that it has a watch display on it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fitzjarrell

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best activity monitors out there
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best activity monitors out there. I have had it for over a year now and still love it! Update: This is my all time favorite watch and activity monitor. I finally changed the battery after 2 years!
customer_reviews.author: HAPPY HEART

customer_reviews.title: A good device but extremely limited in function
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's my fault for not reading the product description more carefully, but I'm very disappointed by this device. It seems like good quality for the price but is limited in function. It's really only useful for tracking your steps and sleep. It doesn't track the type of exercise you do, the intensity of that exercise, or your heart rate. I think you have to get accessories for the device in order to do these things. You also have to remember to put your device in sleep mode in order to record your sleep. Be aware before buying this device, that it's only really for counting steps and recording sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: One year batter, constant time display and waterproof - no other device does that
customer_reviews.text: Super device - I had a UP and my wife had a fitbit. Each had to be charged every week - vivofit 2 has a one year battery. Those other devices are not waterproof - I sit in my spa 5-6 times a week and the watch is not adversely affected. It shows the time all day - so it is not in addition to your watch - it is your watch - and it lights up so that you can see the time at night. The sync to iPhone or iPad can be a little clunky but that is a very small price to pay for all the great features of this tracker that others simply don't have
customer_reviews.author: Mark H. Kolman

customer_reviews.title: Good motivator.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product around Thanksgiving last year. So far, I really enjoy it. It helps motivate me to keep moving during the day, thanks to the red bar reminder. I like the fact that I never have to charge the battery. The best part is that it is water proof, and I don't have to take it off during my water aerobics classes. The one thing I don't like about it is that it counts steps when it shouldn't, like when I am in the shower, it shows that I walked a bunch of steps. Now I just take it off while showering so that it is more accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to.. or maybe not
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Wish it had more friends on it to compete with. Happy with the product. EDIT: after a few months, no longer tracks steps accurately. Locks up and requires a good smack to get it to count steps again. Obviously a faulty accelerometer. Miles calculated is horrible. Setting a custom stride doesn't change the accuracy... in fact it setting your custom stride seems to be more of an extra menu feature that was never actually implemented for the device. See the picture? I started the treadmill at the same time as the activity on my band. It appears to be inaccurate 25% or more. Abhorrent.
customer_reviews.author: Not a Robot

customer_reviews.title: Works great and love the battery life
customer_reviews.text: Owned it for 2 months so far. No complaints. It's not 100% accurate but no activity tracker is. The one on the iPhone 6 I have is supposed to be very accurate. My Vivofit matches my phone very closely when I have compared them. My favorite thing is that it's small and doesn't need recharging like I see with most activity trackers. Garmins website and mobile app are some of the best I've seen out there too, especially the latest app update. Update: I bought this August 3rd, 2015. It's now Jan 21, 2017. Battery is still fine, bluetooth works fine, sleep tracking is good, same band holding up great, etc. Thing is still working just like day 1.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Great sidekick
customer_reviews.text: Like that I don't have to recharging or replace batteries. The battery lasts a year. Automatically syncs with my phone and tablet. It requires no maintenance and I never take it off. It died after 3 years so I bought another one. Didn't upgrade because of the battery issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ely Tymro

customer_reviews.title: A Nice Upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: This vivofit 2 is an improvement over the original vivofit. I especially like the way it locks when on your wrist without the bulk of the additional security band. The backlit display is another nice upgrade. I have been using this item for about two months now and would recommend it to those who enjoy tracking their physical fitness activities.
customer_reviews.author: InMyTime

customer_reviews.title: Batteries lasted 2.5 years
customer_reviews.text: I have loved my vivofit 2 for the 2.5 years I've owned it. Sadly the batteries does last weekend and while they were easy to replace, after 1 week, the vivofit is dead again. I'm lost without it! I guess I'll be looking for a new tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Yates

customer_reviews.title: Won't Sync, Won't Keep Track Automatically On A Computer
customer_reviews.text: I like the device but there are nothing but problems with it syncing. It won't stay synced, you can't track your activity and when you try to re-sync it doesn't work at all. I Googled the problem and evidently this has been going on with this device for years. If you want to keep track, stay away from this device. I've been told by Garmin that this device won't automatically sync with a computer, you have to do a manual sync. good device for the money, if you are going to sync on computer be advised.
customer_reviews.author: Julie A.

customer_reviews.title: No charging, long lasting battery.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Vivofit 2. First one lasted several years. Battery lasted almost 2 years. Bought it for sleep tracking, also for steps and swimming. I don’t remove when swimming or showering. Band can be difficult to fasten, but genuine Garmin bands easier than generic bands.
customer_reviews.author: Meme

customer_reviews.title: I thought I couldn't live without mywatch, but I always have this set on
customer_reviews.text: I think it works fairly well! Yeah I get a lot of steps just showering and doing my hair in the morning, but I miss a lot of steps pushing grocery carts.....so I figure it all evens out in the end. It's held up well so far, but I've only had it a month or so. I thought I couldn't live without my watch, but I always have this set on watch mode and don't seem to miss my watch. Over all great investment. Paid $129, then 29 days later saw that the price dropped to $99, e-mailed Amazon and they credited me $30! Amazon customer service is incredible!
customer_reviews.author: laurstelli

customer_reviews.title: I really like the sleep tracking feature
customer_reviews.text: I really like the sleep tracking feature. Not so sure about the step tracking as I can rack up steps just by washing my hair! Since it is worn on the wrist, it tracks my arm movements, which my arms do move when I walk. However, I have to remind myself to only push a shopping cart with one hand so that my steps will count while traveling through the store. I like that I don't have to take it off to shower or charge. Band is very secure and no worries about losing it!
customer_reviews.author: Tamera Simonson

customer_reviews.title: Question the accuracy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of water aerobics and water walking so I bought this because it is waterproof but after 2 hours of water jogging and water aerobics it only tracked under 1800 steps... My fit bit is much more accurate... as I have counted of the steps... I understand it detects arm movement but I use barbells so I am moving my arms... Also the button to push to get a reading is very hard to push and the sinc is almost impossible DO NOT BUY THIS it s a waste I have been wearing my fit bit as well as the garmin for a week now and there is such a discrepancy in the steps it is joke
customer_reviews.author: B. Drummond

customer_reviews.title: You can wear this in water and no charging is involved.
customer_reviews.text: I like this so much better than the fitbit because you can wear in while swimming or taking a shower or in the rain without worrying about ruining it. Also no charging is the best. Its a pain when your trying to meet your goal and your fitbit dies. not the garmin because battery lasts over a year.
customer_reviews.author: FLYERS FAN

customer_reviews.title: I love this! There are some things I wish it ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this! There are some things I wish it did better, sure...but the fact that it is waterproof is priceless. I haven't taken mine off in months - (well, I did to paint) - wear it swimming, shower, dishes, etc. I love that I don't have to charge it! The app it syncs with is ok - not in love with it and its estimate of miles walked is not accurate (tracked the miles with a gps device to check) but the steps seem to be quite accurate and the waterproof, no-charging feature is fabulous!
customer_reviews.author: shannon

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work like it should out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed so far. Pros: The band is comfortable, the display is clear, and the step "counting" seems accurate. Cons: I can not seem to get it to tell time, get an audible alert, track my sleep or Synch with my devices. I'm not enjoying trying to navigate their help pages to determine how to fix this either.
customer_reviews.author: ZooCrew

customer_reviews.title: Everyday use. Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I use it everyday. I bought it to replace the last one that the plastic that keep it together with the band was broken after using it for over 2 years that I had and I will not buy an updated version as you have to charge those every day plus are more expensive (double price) and the battery for this one last a year and you can change it yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really helps me walk more and is accurate
customer_reviews.text: I love this device. I've used a Fitbit and a polar in the past and I much prefer the Garmin. The audible alert that tells you to get off your lazy bum and start walking is actually useful. The Garmin connect app used to be complete garbage but with updates over the last couple months, it's finally quite stable. Yes this syncs with myfitnesspal. It also syncs with Virgin Pulse. I've noticed myself walking a lot more since I bought it. The one thing I wish it had was waterproofing. It's splash resistant but I'd love to take it in the pool with me.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Long battery life, water proof watch.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Vivofit. I lost the first one because it fell off. The locking band in this one solves that problem. I had the first one for two years and didn’t have to change the battery! I wear it when I swim, kayak and snorkel. Great value for the price. I try to sync with the app on my phone every morning. I like to check the sleep setting.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: No charging needed!
customer_reviews.text: This is convenient as I don't need to charge the battery. I wear it all the time to track my steps and sleep pattern. It is comfortable and I hardly notice it's on my wrist. I use it as a watch, too. It looks nice and people notice it. One thing is that it's hard to sync by bluetooth. I use Nexus 7 tablet and my cell phone to sync, but it is hits and misses. I think it's the app which is causing this problem. I hope Garmin will improve the app.
customer_reviews.author: Hello Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Really enjoying the product
customer_reviews.text: Love this Garmin Watch. It does everything I was looking for it to do. I love the alerts I get when I have been sitting for too long. Keeps me moving and keeps me wanting to push myself everyday to do better than what I did the day before. Only issue I have is when I received Garmin, it had a small little scratch on the screen in the bottom left corner. I thought I could ignore but it actually bothers me a lot especially when it was not caused by me. I'm hoping I will be able to exchange without problems because I spent a lot on this to get with something on there not created by myself.
customer_reviews.author: Amra Miles Webster

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully Provides Reasonably Accurate Feedback
customer_reviews.text: Haven't totally made up my mind yet, though first impressions have been positive. I like that it automatically converts steps into mileage and one can easily read progress during the day. Was easy to set up, even for me, and seems at least reasonably accurate. I'm also happy that it isn't affected by bicycling, though it does overreact to normal hand-movement activities such as dressing. It's wristband, however, is beyond belief - about as cheap and clumsy as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Loyd Eskildson

customer_reviews.title: It calculates very well and love that it includes time and date
customer_reviews.text: I am loving this vivo fit. It calculates very well and love that it includes time and date. I am updating my review. It’s going to be 2 years this dec since I purchased the garmin vivofit. I’ve had no problems with this fit. I rarely take it off. The battery is barely running low after having it for almost 2 years. I love this Vivofit. I think it’s way better than the Fitbit at half the cost. I give this 5 stars! Thanks vivofit! Best thing that I purchased! 👍
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Esparza

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite step tracker. Simple, big numbers for my old eyes, and lots of band options.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Mom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read and use basic fitness watch.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third fitness watch I purchased before I found one I liked. The face is easy to read, even outside. It uses a battery so no charging is required. I wear it all the time, including in the shower. Some of the more expensive watches have more features, but this is a durable, easy to use basic tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela S. Ford

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing - Battery only lasts less than a month
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was going to be a great way to start tracking activity. Have had the tracker for less than a month and battery already needs to be replaced - description says battery lasts at least one year. Not even close - 3 weeks in and the battery needs to be replaced. Syncing the device to garmin connect and app is also not simple, you must use the USB provided with the tracker. Syncing to the app only happens when you manually do it. Not what I would have expected from Garmin
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not durable.  Lasted barely one year.
customer_reviews.text: Usually Garmin makes good products, but the vivofit just is not durable. Had this for just over a year, but not really used that much. Recently a circle (silver and red) started developing and got bigger and bigger, to the point where one of the time digits is covered up and no longer readable. Unfortunately, it's past the one year warranty, so this is going into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: J. W.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: This is a revised review. I ordered this one a 14 months ago. I replaced the batteries last week. Now, half of the display doesn't work. I just ordered another one. This is the third one I've had to buy in just as many years. What an immense waste of money so far. I've invested nearly $300 just to track my fitness and sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Joland7000

customer_reviews.title: Longer lasting than Duracell!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I know this is old now, and nobody probably wants this model. But this watch is been through thick and thin for several years and never let me down. Don’t have to charge it, and Never even had to have the battery replaced!!!
customer_reviews.author: REDSOUZA

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but not great either.
customer_reviews.text: I'm decently pleased with this product. It seems to count steps pretty accurately as long as you are moving your arms. It doesn't record bike rides, or swimming, etc you have to log those manually. I think the greatest feature is it doesn't need charged and its waterproof so it literally never has to come off. I wear mine in the shower, pool, at the lake, doesn't matter it stays on. I wish I had known it doesn't record activities like biking and swimming on its own because I probably would have spent the extra money to upgrade to one with GPS.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee Jo

customer_reviews.title: VIVOFIT2 was not working at all
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to this VIVOFIT2 but it wouldn't work even though I called GARMIN and they walked me though the PAIR process - it was not working - just unmeaningful numbers then stayed with ZERO. I trusted GARMIN as a company ( and I feel they are a good company ) but I should have looked at the total reviews before buying; and the people making this product need to correct the problems. VERY DISAPPOINTING. Sent back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery was corroded when purchased
customer_reviews.text: Bought the red Vivofit 2 as a Xmas gift but it only worked for less than 24 hours. Opened the tracker to check the batteries and found that one battery and all the metals connectors were corroded and there was rust everywhere. The tracker was operating when I received it, so the batteries had obviously been in use for some time. I am sending it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love my Garmin Vivofit 2!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. This is my second Garmin Vivofit and this is a good upgrade to the prior product. Also quite pleased that they have fixed the buckle or clasp on the back so there is now NO chance of it slipping off the wrist. Also thrilled that it now has backlighting. I can't wear any fitness tracker with metal on the band since I am allergic to nickel in the metal, so the fact that this is 100% plastic is great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jan C. Bozman

customer_reviews.title: I really like my the Garmin Vivofit 2 it seems pretty accurate ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like my the Garmin Vivofit 2 it seems pretty accurate and it was easy to set up with the Garmin Connect App on my phone and the Fitness App that pairs with it. It is a great motivator for me to move and to eat better and watch my diet more closely. I like that it has the sleep feature, the light up feature for at night, you can see it perfectly during the day, it has a larger reading area, I never thought that I would buy something like this, but I needed some motivation and this does it for me. There is nothing that I can say as a con on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Debra L. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Wish I got this much sooner! I love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it, arrived quickly and I have been wearing it daily since it arrived. I even shower with it and when I wear it in the steam room and sauna with no problems. The battery life is very good, does not need any charging since the battery is supposed to last for one year. Overall, just very happy I purchased this. Got the black one for myself and the pink one for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: This activity tracker is amazing. I had a fitbit charge and Garmin is ...
customer_reviews.text: This activity tracker is amazing. I had a fitbit charge and Garmin is so much better. I hate charging the fitbit constantly. Tracking is so much more accurate with the Garmin. With having a new baby, the fitbit doens't track all my steps when carrying my son around in the wee hours of the morning. The Garmin tracks the steps without needing my arm to swing. The only thing the fitbit does better is be backlit. Not enough for me to switch back to it from the Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. MeL

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: I've now used this for over two weeks and it is just what I'd hoped for--a watch to wear while swimming and a reminder to get up and walk around when I've been sitting too long. The step data is easy to read, and the light useful at night. The audible reminder is a quiet chirp - not at all intrusive if you're in conversation but noticeable while you're working quietly. The accompanying website (and associated app) is pretty basic and not terribly convenient for adding other activities but it keeps track generally. The sleep tracking is helpful, too. The clasp is sturdy; no need for additions to the band.
customer_reviews.author: blueheron

customer_reviews.title: This is nothing more than a cheap pedometer
customer_reviews.text: This is nothing more than a cheap pedometer. False advertising. It says claims to track time and distance. Time of day I guess, if that counts. To find your distance you need to do the do the math with your steps. This is not a device for runners to track their running distance and running time. Returned and quite unhappy with Garmin for what I think is false advertising.
customer_reviews.author: J. Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Great Activity tracker.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. I had my first Garmin for 2 years. I love being able to swim shower and not have to worry about charging it. I needed a replacement bracelet, I purchased SnowCinda Fitness Replacement Bands for Garmin Vivofit. the prongs were too short and I lost my first one. I hope this one is as dependable as my first one was.
customer_reviews.author: Frugal Mom

customer_reviews.title: Love the fact that battery lasts a year or more
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a pedometer for my wrist as I keep losing the one that fall off my waist. This does what I want. Tells number of steps, distance, calories, and sets goals. Other functions I don't use. Love the fact that battery lasts a year or more. My wife has to charge her Fitbit every couple of days. What a hassle. Would have given 5 stars except didn't count most steps mowing lawn. Also I have to take it off when practicing my drum set as it will register as steps. Very happy. Does what I need at s good price.
customer_reviews.author: WALLYTHESNARE

customer_reviews.title: make sure its compatible with your device
customer_reviews.text: Would give 5 stars, however I'm a bit disappointed because I bought 3 different tablets because it wasn't compatible with phone and none of the tablets either. It was compatible with the amazon fire 5th generation but amazon does not have the Garmin connect app, so therefore you can't sync. So make sure you have a compatible device before purchasing. Overall I love it, I believe it is very accurate. It has encouraged me to do more and overall I've lost 30 lbs :)
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as a gift for my grandmother who loves to walk everyday. She has heard the hype of all these new fitness bands and wanted to try one out to count her steps so she can stay on track everyday. I feared she would learn how to use it being technology illiterate, but she had no problems at all figuring it out! She loves it and always shows it off to family!
customer_reviews.author: Seth R

customer_reviews.title: 2 years still going!
customer_reviews.text: I have put this watch through hell and back. Twice I forgot to take it off diving and it has survived no problem down to 84ft! I bought it 2 years ago and the battery still works, incredible. I use the timer all the time for workouts and sync my data weekly without any issues. I have tried fitbits and other and they are a hassle that doesn’t provide extra value. This watch is a part of my body now and I never have to take it off. Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan B.

customer_reviews.title: I love mine!
customer_reviews.text: After being a Fit Bit veteran, I decided to switch to the Garmin 3 months ago after a coworker showed me hers. What sold me is that you don't have to charge the battery every few days like the Fit Bit. It's a watch that has a battery that should last a year. The only thing I do not care for is that you have to go on the app on your phone and sync for it to update your steps and sleep habits, whereas, the Fit Bit did that automatically. I still love my Garmin!
customer_reviews.author: Educ8m

customer_reviews.title: Once I got it set up and the app on ...
customer_reviews.text: Once I got it set up and the app on my phone I was set to go. I am new to activity trackers so I was not sure what to expect. The only problem I noticed is that it always says it synced to phone at 12:44am so if you wanted your steps on the phone sooner you had to manually sync it.
customer_reviews.author: YankeePooh

customer_reviews.title: Best step tracker
customer_reviews.text: Use my Tracker everyday. I sync it with my kids and keep track of my steps and sleep habits. Love the fact that you don't have to charge it everyday or week. The new locking mechanism is a terrific upgrade. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Zesbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Great long term battery.
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be working most of the time. I'm not certain but I seem to be having an issue when I activate the timer and then activate the heart rate function. I do have the chest strap and program the Vivofit 2 for that function but sometimes it will not work with the timer function.
customer_reviews.author: MrFlash

customer_reviews.title: Does not automatically sync
customer_reviews.text: I keep forgetting to sync and have to be reminded. I don't even know it is there, Band stays on and it has been working without issues for several years,.
customer_reviews.author: frandma

customer_reviews.title: enhancing my awareness of what i'm doing
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how much this has really helped me. I have an uber hard time with diets and losing weight, over 50 and 4'11" is even more challenging. I am doing it though, this tracker really helps me to stay on point. The garmin connect site paired with the my fitness pal site also makes it easier. It helps you keep track of how you're eating and keeps you more aware of what you are or should be doing.
customer_reviews.author: AnnaV

customer_reviews.title: Get started.
customer_reviews.text: If anyone needed to get out of the chair and get active, it's me. I like having to get up and moving every hour, it helps getting the blood and muscles going. You can go online to see how you have been doing. Offers many things you can do with it. Keeps your daily weight, steps, activites, sleep patterns, calories burn, etc. If you want to doing something for yourself, then take the first step to a healthier you.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: It did not sink with my iphone. Also there ...
customer_reviews.text: It did not sink with my iphone. Also there was a big discrepancy between the number of steps showed on garmin and number of Steps On Health app on The iPhone when i had both of them with me. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Flor N.

customer_reviews.title: my favorite
customer_reviews.text: I started with the fitbit but when I was ready to upgrade I did a lot of research and landed on the Garmin Vivofit. I LOVED IT. I lost it when I took it off on vacation. So I got the Vivofit 2 as a replacement and LOVE it too. Info seems to be accurate, I love the audible notice to get up and move, I have the chest band to record my HR when doing cardio, it is comfortable, it pairs with MyFitnessPal. I LOVE this tracker.
customer_reviews.author: K. L. Klein

product_meta.title: Garmin vívofit 2 Activity Tracker, Black
product_meta.description:
Style:US Version| Color:Black

ACTIVITY TRACKER WITH MOVE BAR AND ALERTS
 * Features 1+ year battery life
 * Reminds you to stay active with move bar and audible alert
 * Learns your activity level and proposes a personalized daily goal
 * Shows steps, calories, distance and time of day on backlit display; monitors sleep
 * Automatically syncs to Garmin Connect to save, plan and share progress

Get up and get moving with vívofit 2. It’s the only activity tracker with a 1+ year battery life and backlit display. It even reminds you to stay active throughout your day with its move bar with audible alert that lets you know when you’ve been idle for an hour or longer.

TELLS TIME AND “TIME TO MOVE”
Research shows prolonged periods of inactivity such as sitting at a desk decreases your body’s production of fat-burning enzymes. You can reverse that effect by taking frequent, short walk breaks throughout your day. And while you might lose track of time and forget to move, vívofit 2 knows. A red move bar appears on the display and a gentle alert sounds after one hour of inactivity. The move bar builds every 15 minutes until you reset it by walking for a couple of minutes. Don’t want to be bothered with a beep every hour? Set up your compatible mobile device to vibrate as your cue to move.

24/7 WEARABLE
vívofit 2 follows your progress 24/7 and shows your steps, calories, distance and time of day on its easy-to-read, backlit display. Set the sleep mode when you go to bed and it will monitor your rest. At Garmin Connect, you can see your total sleep hours as well as periods of movement and restful sleep. vívofit 2 is water-resistant¹, so you can shower or get caught in the rain, worry-free. And thanks to its 1+ year battery life, you can keep this activity tracker on your wrist around the clock, helping you turn good intentions into lifelong habits. The band is soft and flexible and features a quarter-turn buckle that secures it to your wrist. Optional accessory bands in various color schemes let you coordinate your vívofit to your wardrobe.

PERSONALIZED DAILY GOALS
vívofit 2 learns your current activity level, then assigns an attainable daily goal. As you meet your milestones, vívofit 2 will adjust your goal for the next day, gradually nudging you toward a healthier lifestyle. At Garmin Connect, our free online fitness community, you can earn virtual badges and view your progress.

KEEP COUNT
When you’re ready to take the next steps toward better health, vívofit 2 has additional features to keep you motivated. Use the activity timer to record a timed activity, such as a walk or run, which can be saved and sent to Garmin Connect. You can also pair vívofit 2 with a heart rate monitor² during fitness activities, such as a run or a cardio class at the gym, to record your heart rate and zone data and get more accurate calorie burn information. For detailed calorie tracking, you can create an account at MyFitnessPal and link it to your Garmin Connect account. This allows you to compare calories consumed to your total calories burned, which vívofit 2 records throughout the day.

GET CONNECTED
Throughout your day, vívofit 2 automatically syncs to Garmin Connect, where you can see a complete picture of your progress, join online challenges and earn virtual badges for extra motivation. It's so simple to get started. After you are set up, access our free online community from your computer or on your compatible mobile device³ with the Garmin Connect Mobile app.

In the Box

 * vívofit 2 with large and small band
 * USB ANT Stick
 * Documentation

1Water rating: 5 ATM (50 meters)
2Included with some models, sold separately on others.
3See Garmin.com/BLE for a list of compatible phones.
feature_bullets: Move bar w/audible alert - Reminds you to stay active throughout the day by displaying a red move bar and sounding an alert after one hour of inactivity. Additional segments lightup for every 15 minutes of inactivity. Walk for a couple of minutes to reset.
BACKLIT DISPLAY - The display is always on so you won’t miss a beat. Turn on the backlight to see your stats, even in the dark.

ACTIVITY TIMER - Record activities with or without a heart rate monitor. Water rating:5 ATM. Display resolution : Segmented LCD. Sleep monitoring (monitors total sleep and periods of movement or restful sleep)
1 + year battery life - vίvofit 2 stays on for more than a year without having to change the battery, so you don’t have to worry about recharging.
Auto Sync - vίvofit 2 automatically syncs with paired mobile devices at strategic times throughout the day, such as when a goal is met or when several steps have been taken since the last sync.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars3,533 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Additional Features: Fitness_tracker, Social_media_notifications, Sleep_monitor, Email, Digital_time_display, Text, Pedometer, Music_player, Multisport_tracking
